裷字的基本解释

裷
yuān
古代指覆盖东西的巾帕：“卫人有佐弋者，鸟至，因先以其裷麾之。”

裷
gǔn
古通“衮”，古代帝王和诸侯穿的绣有龙纹的礼服：“故天子袾裷衣冕，诸侯玄裷衣冕。”

裷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yuān］
［《廣韻》於袁切，平元，影。］
［《廣韻》去阮切，上阮，溪。］
头巾。《韩非子·外储说左上》：“衛人有佐弋者，鳥至，因先以其裷麾之，鳥驚而不射也。”王先慎集解：“《方言》：'襎裷謂之幭。'郭注：'即帊幞也。'”一说指拴在箭上的生丝绳。梁启雄解：“太田方曰：'裷者，弓繳轉卷之繩索也。'”
[②]［gǔn］
［《字彙》古本切］
同“衮1”。

裷字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　裷； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1119第05
【唐韻】【集韻】?於袁切，音鴛。【揚子·方言】襎裷謂之幭。【郭註】卽帊幞也。【韓非子·外儲說左篇】衞人有佐弋者，鳥至，因先以其裷麾之焉。　又【廣韻】去阮切，音綣。【類篇】委遠切，音宛。窘遠切，音圈。義?同。　又讀作袞。【荀子·富國篇】天子袾裷衣冕。【楊倞註】裷與袞同。

裷字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
裷字的起名意思

暂无。

裷
Basic explanation of words
裷
yuān
In ancient times, it refers to a scarf that covers things: "There are guards who are swaying people, and the birds are here, because they are the first to use them."
裷
gǔn
Gu Tong "Dun", the ancient emperor and princes wear embroidered dragon-print dresses: "So the emperor's robe has a robe, and the princes' mysterious robes."
裷
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yuān］
["Guangyun" in Yuanqie, Pingyuan, Shadow. ]
["Guangyun" goes to Ruan Qi, Shang Ruan, Xi. ]
scarf. "Han Feizi·Foreign Chu Shu said the upper left": "The guardian has a survivor, and the bird arrives, because the bird is frightened first, and the bird is not shot." Yi.'Guo's Note:'That's 帊幞 Ye.'" One refers to the raw silk rope tied to the arrow. Liang Qixiong explained: "Ota Fang said: "The one who bows and turns the rope is also.""
[②]［gǔn］
[Ancient version of "Words"]
Same as "Dagon 1".
裷
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Jixia] [Department of Clothing Characters] 　裷; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1119 05
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Yu Yuanqie, Yin Yuan. 【Yangtze Dialect】It is called the "Yang Tzu". [Guo Note] 卽帊幞 also. [Han Feizi·Foreign Reserve Talking Left] The guardian has a survivor, and the bird arrives, because it is first known for its sorrow.　[Guang Yun] Go to Ruan Qi, the sound is 绻. 【Classes】Wei Yuanqie, Sound Wan. Difficult to cut far away, voice coil. Righteous? Same.　Pronounced Dagon again. [Xunzi·Fu Guo Chapter] The emperor's robes and crowns. 【Yang Jie's Note】The same as Dagon.
